nodes.text: To what do I owe the honor of this visit?
I just wanted to learn a little more about this class.

options.text: Ask About the Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: What's the reward for becoming 'Rogue of the Year?'
You mean besides having the respect and adulation of your peers?
The Rogue of the Year will be in contention for the 'coveted' position of "Student of the Year', competing with students of all the other classes.
That's it?
You seem underwhelmed by such an esteemed honor.
(shrug) As long as I have earned your respect, then who cares about anything else?
Flattery is a useful tool for a Rogue. I am gratified to see that you are practicing your skills.
When you flatter someone, try not to shovel it on so thickly. You do not want them to recognize that you are attempting to manipulate them.
(shrug) It's just that I have better things to do here than compete in a popularity contest.
A very useful point of view to take - far too many people waste their lives vying for the elusive praise of other people.
However, to earn the title of Rogue of the Year, you have to go to great lengths to prove your skills and your worth as a hero. Those are, in and of themselves, valuable.
I'm supposed to go out of my way to earn a meaningless title just so that I can compete to earn another even more meaningless title?
Participation in the contest is neither mandatory nor actively encouraged. However, it is a competition - a game or sport you may or may not choose to play.
If you do not compete then you simply do not win.
Only idiots compete when the only reward for hard work is more work.
Ah, but work is frequently a reward in and of itself. It just depends upon the nature of the work.
How am I expected to buy things like lockpicks and books when I'm restricted staying inside the castle?
There is an activity of which you may not be aware - it is called, 'work.' This is where you do something in order to earn money.
I believe that Chef Kinah can always use some assistance in the Dining Hall and kitchen.
I spoke with Esme about her test. She's was really upset that she couldn't do better on it.
She's really good at practicing her skills, so I wondered why she did so poorly on the test. She said it was because she has a hard time reading what you write for the test.
So what are you suggesting be done about the problem?
I spoke to Thomas about it. He said that he'd try to help her.
An interesting approach to the situation. I will speak with Fräulein Esme about the matter myself.
Maybe you could talk to her. I think she's too embarrassed to come to you.
There are many challenges in life - the ability to face one's fears is an important one for many to master.
Why is it that a group of Rogues are expected to follow the rules? Aren't Rogues supposed to break rules?
They are more what you'd call guidelines than actual rules. However, if you deliberately break the rules - you had better be prepared to face the consequences.
The rules are good. I want to do everything I can to fit in the Disbarred Bards class, sir.
I do not doubt your abilities to be a Rogue, Herr O'Conner.
I do not doubt your abilities to be a Rogue, Herr O'Conner. However, you need to be more subtle with your sycophancy.
So the most important rule of them all is "Don't get Caught?" Ah, that means we always need to show you respect, as well, or we'd break that rule.
It would be wisest to do so.
Sounds like a Rogue has to be good at what he does and what he does has to be good, is that it? You have to toe the line with the guidelines - if you step out of line, you'll be towed off.
Interpret the rules as you like, but yes, you are expected to at least appear to follow these guidelines.

options.text: Ask If You Can Help the Master

nodes.text: Seeing as we're supposed to do good deeds and act heroic at this school, is there anything I can do for you? You know, some favor or task in order to curry favor and earn brownie points...
At the moment, the only thing I need from you is for you to take this class seriously and study your lessons.
Impress me by what you do for yourself rather than by what you can do for me.
I do not award brownie points in this class.
Thank you for your time. Good afternoon, sir.
Good afternoon, then. Return to your studies.
